title: Frøskeland
text:
Frøskeland () is a <a href="village">village</a> in <a href="Sortland%20Municipality">Sortland Municipality</a> in <a href="Nordland">Nordland</a> county, <a href="Norway">Norway</a>. 
Geography.
Frøskeland lies on the island of <a href="Lang%C3%B8ya">Langøya</a>, at the innermost part of <a href="Eidsfjorden%20%28Nordland%29">Eidsfjorden</a>, on the west side of the <a href="Vikeid">Vikeid</a> <a href="isthmus">isthmus</a>. <a href="Norwegian%20County%20Road%20820">County Road 820</a> from the <a href="Sortland%20%28town%29">town of Sortland</a> to <a href="B%C3%B8%20Municipality%20%28Nordland%29">Bø Municipality</a> passes through Frøskeland. <a href="Norwegian%20County%20Road%20821">County Road 821</a> to the village of <a href="Myre%2C%20%C3%98ksnes">Myre</a> branches off from County Road 820 at Frøskeland and travels north across <a href="Fr%C3%B8skelandseid">Frøskelandseid</a> (the Frøskeland Isthmus) to <a href="Steinlandsfjord">Steinlandsfjord</a> in <a href="%C3%98ksnes%20Municipality">Øksnes Municipality</a>. Frøskeland is also the junction for <a href="Norwegian%20County%20Road%20885">County Road 885</a>, which travels south along the east side of the Eidsfjorden to the villages of <a href="Holmstad">Holmstad</a>, <a href="Sandnes%2C%20Nordland">Sandnes</a>, and the <a href="Hadsel%20Bridge">Hadsel Bridge</a>.
Name.
The name "Frøskeland" is believed to derive from the word "frøskja", related to the verb "fryse" which means 'freeze'.
Industry and services.
The concrete factory Vesterålsbetong AS (formerly Tingvoll Betong AS and SE Betong AS) is located in Frøskeland. Frøskeland had a post office until June 1, 1997.
